comments:
Final semester of a two year sequence designed to integrate real world experiences into various Bioengineering and Bioengineering Science courses. It is required for only BSE majors, and is intended for the spring semester of Junior year.

For the most part, students were enthusiastic about this class. Onstudent said it was the “best BE lab I’ve taken.” The fact that it is a six-hour lab that meets every week, many noted that it was extremely “time-consuming.”

Students did not have much to say about Professor Tsourkas’s teaching, other than remarking how infrequently both the Professor and the TA’s were present, and therefore unable to answer questions.

Many students said that this course was “a lot of work.” It exposed students to “the challenging and time consuming aspects of lab work in bioengineering” and was therefore a good class, but the amount of class time and lab time was significant.

Final semester of a two-year sequence designed to integrate real world experiences into various Bioengineering and Bioengineering Science courses.

Overall, students found this course both interesting and challenging. However, they reported that the lab reports were “extremely time consuming outside of the lab,” and often were simply “restating what [had] happened in the experiment.” Some indicated that the labs “did not really introduce any new concepts outside of prior biology classes,” and thus did not prepare them well for Senior Design.

The majority of students reported that neither the TAs nor professors were available during most of the lab time period to answer questions they had about the experiments.

This course is required for BE students in the BSE program. It is intended for the spring semester of the junior year.
